text: Privacy | Docs | Twitter Developer Platform Privacy Â  What information does Twitter collect through Twitter for Websites and how is that information used? When you view Twitter content or Twitter products integrated into other websites using Twitter for Websites, Twitter may receive information including the web page you visited, your IP address, browser type, operating system, and cookie information. This information helps us to improve our products and services, includingÂ  personalized suggestions Â andÂ  personalized ads . Learn more about the information we receive and how we use it in ourÂ  privacy policy Â andÂ  cookies use . Â  How long do you keep this information? To protect privacy, we never associate this web browsing history with usersâ names, email addresses, phone numbers, or Twitter handles, and we delete, obfuscate, or aggregate it after no longer than 30 days, as explained in ourÂ  Privacy Policy . Â  What privacy options do website publishers have? You may choose whether Twitter widgets on your site help to tailor content and suggestions for Twitter users. You can opt out of having information from your website used for personalization by following the instructions below. Include the following snippet within theÂ Â andÂ Â elements on your pages that include Twitter for Websites widgets: Code copied to clipboard You may also opt-out of this data use for a specific widget, and can do so by setting the optionalÂ data-dntÂ parameter to be true, as shown in the example below: Tweet Code copied to clipboard What privacy options do users have? In addition to the choices websites have regarding personalizing content on Twitter, we remain committed to providing users with simple and meaningful privacy choices about how their information is used to improve their Twitter experience.
